document.masterDocTitle: Chilarboreus gen. nov., a new genus of Chilean Scirtidae (Coleoptera: Scirtoidea), with descriptions of three new species

caption.paragraph:
Figure 3.
Chilarboreus ( Chilarboreus ) fossulatus
, male (A) Dorsal view; (B) basal portion of antenna; (C) abdomen; (D) head, dorsal view; (E) mouthparts; (F) subfemoral groove; (G) tibia and tarsus; (H) pronotum; (I) basal portion of pronotum; (J) ventral view. Abbreviations: ac, anteclypeus; af, antennal fossa; apf, anterior pronotal fossa; bpf, basal pronotal fossa; bpg, basal pronotal groove; cl, clypeus; cs, cervical sclerite; mg, metaventral groove; sc, supraantennal carina; sfg, subfemoral groove; sgr, subgenal ridge. Scale bars 0.5 mm (A, C, J); 0.1 mm (B, D–I).

Figure 4.
Chilarboreus ( Chilarboreus ) fossulatus
, male genitalia. (A) Aedeagus; (B) sternite 9; (C) tergite 8; (D) tergite 9. Abbreviations: pe, penis; tg, tegmen. Scale bar 0.1 mm.

Figure 5.
Chilarboreus ( Chilarboreus ) fossulatus
, female. (A) Head and pronotum; (B) pterothorax, ventral view. Scale bar 0.2 mm.

Figure 6.
Chilarboreus ( Chilarboreus ) fossulatus
, female. (A) Abdomen; (B) ventrite 4; (C) ovipositor; (D) coxites; (E) prehensor; (F) tergite 8; (G) sternite 8. Abbreviations: cx, coxites; pr, prehensor. Scale bars 0.5 mm (C, F, G), 0.9 mm (A), 0.25 mm (B, E), 0.2 mm (D).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Similar to
C. acuticollis
, but pronotum with deeper anterior fossae, anterior pronotal angles not marked, penis shorter, trigonium subrectangular, with truncate apex.

Male . Body elongate, slightly widening in posterior portion, moderately flattened, clothed with procumbent setae. Coloration from light to dark brown, without contrasting dorsal pattern. Head as long as wide, c .1.5 times wider than interocular space, concave, covered with subtly granulate punctures; eyes small, moderately protuberant. Antennae moderately long, extending to basal third of elytra; antennomere 1 globular, subquadrate; antennomere 2 cylindrical, slightly narrower than antennomere 1; antennomere 3 long, c .1.3 times longer than antennomere 2; antennomeres 4–10 gradually shortening, triangularly widened; apical antennomere very wide, oval, as long as antennomere 3. Pronotum transversely rectangular, sides subparallel, widest at posterior angles; disc convex; sides abruptly depressed, with deep fossae in anterolateral angles; anterolateral angles right-angled, not produced. Punctation of pronotum subtly granulate on disc, distinctly granulate on sides. Basal groove well marked, ended with deep fossae. Elytral punctation irregular, relatively sparse; punctures slightly elongated, separated by c .2.0 diameters. Subfemoral grooves with distinct hexagonal microreticulation. Aedeagus relatively short (L / W = 2.1); parameroids very narrow, digitiform. Trigonium wide, subrectangular, with truncate apex. Measurements of male genitalia: aedeagus (L 0.30, W 0.14 ); sternite 9 (L 0.16, W 0.19 ); tergite 8 (L 0.33, W 0.20 ); tergite 9 (L 0.28, W 0.17 ).
Total length of body only slightly variable.

Purén / Contulmo,
Provincia de Malleco
, Región de La Araucanía
;
Oncol,
34 km La Unión
, Llancacura , Chaihuín , Curiñanco , Provincia de Valdivia , Región de Los Ríos
;
Chinquén,
Provincia de Chiloé
, Región de los Lagos
.
Latin fossa – depression, cavity; refering to deep depressions in the anterolateral portions of pronotum.
